alfredsnippet.snippet:
A Number of Martian Features Seem to Plainly Point to Electrical Inferences on Mars

(1) The pit chain region of Mars, Tractus Catena, is a smoking gun image which should have forever altered planetary scientists' approach to both craters and rilles throughout the solar system.  The two classes of features can plainly be seen to be different manifestations of the same phenomenon in this single image ...

http://www.esa.int/spaceinimages/Images/2012/04/Pit-chains_at_high_resolution

(2) The features of Olympus Mons -- it's surrounding moat and its remarkable overlapping scallopped summit craters -- are better described by a fulgurite than a shield volcano ...

https://www.thunderbolts.info/tpod/2004/arch/040705olympus-mons.htm

(3) Ralph Juergens wrote in 1974 of Valles Marineris ...

(cont'd)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - A Number of Martian Features Seem to Plainly Point to Electrical Inferences on Mars - Part 1
